Babynames

Source: vignettes/v05-babynames.Rmd
v05-babynames.Rmd

R packages

Für die folgenden Analysen werden zwei R Pakete benötigt:

library(lisr)
library(tidyverse)

Data import

data <- map_df(2014:2019, get_lis_babynames)

Data exploration

colnames(data)
#> [1] "RANG"        "ANZAHL"      "VORNAME"     "GESCHLECHT"  "YEAR"       
#> [6] "RANG_GESAMT"

Data wrangling


data <- data %>%
  rename(RANK = RANG)
top.10_boys <- data %>%
  filter(GESCHLECHT == "m") %>%
  filter(RANK <= 10) %>%
  pull(VORNAME) %>%
  unique()

top.10_girls <- data %>%
  filter(GESCHLECHT == "w") %>%
  filter(RANK <= 10) %>%
  pull(VORNAME) %>%
  unique()


df.top.10_boys <- data %>%
  filter(GESCHLECHT == "m") %>%
  filter(VORNAME %in% top.10_boys) %>%
  select(-GESCHLECHT, -RANG_GESAMT)

df.top.10_girls <- data %>%
  filter(GESCHLECHT == "w") %>%
  filter(VORNAME %in% top.10_girls) %>%
  select(-GESCHLECHT, -RANG_GESAMT)

Data visualisation

ggplot(
  df.top.10_boys,
  aes(x = YEAR, y = RANK, colour = VORNAME)
) +
  scale_y_reverse(breaks = seq(1, 10, 1), limits = c(10, 1)) +
  geom_line(aes(group = VORNAME), linetype = 3) +
  geom_label(aes(label = VORNAME), fill = "#1e1e1e", hjust = "center") +
  hrbrthemes::theme_modern_rc() +
  theme(
    legend.position = "none",
    panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  ) +
  expand_limits(x = c(2013.8, 2019.1)) +
  ggsci::scale_color_d3("category20") +
  labs(
    title = "Most popular male babynames",
    subtitle = "2014 - 2019"
  )

ggplot(
  df.top.10_girls,
  aes(x = YEAR, y = RANK, colour = VORNAME)
) +
  scale_y_reverse(breaks = seq(1, 10, 1), limits = c(10, 1)) +
  geom_line(aes(group = VORNAME), linetype = 3) +
  geom_label(aes(label = VORNAME), fill = "#1e1e1e") +
  hrbrthemes::theme_modern_rc() +
  theme(
    legend.position = "none",
    panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
  ) +
  expand_limits(x = c(2013.8, 2019.1)) +
  ggsci::scale_color_d3("category20") +
  labs(
    title = "Most popular female babynames",
    subtitle = "2014 - 2019"
  )
